sentence: Some are nuisance candidates, but others are serious, such as GOP district chair Michele Woodhouse and Chuck Edwards, a state senator who represents a significant chunk of the new seat.
title: Opinion: Madison Cawthorn is in trouble. And it's entirely his own fault.

sentence: "We were shocked and disappointed that he yet again made some bizarre comment," said Michele Woodhouse, another GOP primary candidate against Cawthorn, about her opponent's remarks regarding cocaine and orgies in Washington.
author: Melanie Zanona, Manu Raju and Alex Rogers
title: 'He's an embarrassment': Republicans threaten to primary Cawthorn over controversial antics

sentence: Seven Republicans have entered the primary race to oust Cawthorn, with two sources telling the Washington Examiner that state Sen. Chuck Edwards and businesswoman Michele Woodhouse could be viable contenders.
author: Juliegrace Brufke
title: Republicans turn against Rep. Madison Cawthorn after orgies and cocaine comment

sentence: Ahead of the Tar Heel State's May 17 primary, Cawthorn is facing a number of opponents, including: state Sen. Chuck Edwards, whom Tillis said he is endorsing; Michele Woodhouse, a self-described "business-woman and political activist"; Bruce O'Connell, a hotel and restaurant operator; Rod Honeycutt, a retired US Army colonel; Matthew Burril, a businessman and local economic leader; and Wendy Nevarez, a Navy veteran.
author: Rachel Janfaza
title: Who is Madison Cawthorn, the freshman congressman causing headline chaos for the GOP?

title: Cloud of notoriety builds over Cawthorn after sex-and-drugs claims
